lead_paragraph: Rakeyia Scott sought a protective order last year against Mr. Scott, whose death at the hands of the Charlotte, N.C., police has set off protests.

byline.contributor: Richard Fausset reported from Charlotte, and Alan Blinder from Gastonia, N.C. Richard Pérez-Peña contributed reporting from New York.
byline.original: By RICHARD FAUSSET and ALAN BLINDER

headline.print_headline: Wife of Man Killed by Police in Charlotte Sought a Protective Order Against Him
headline.main: Keith Scott Threatened Family, Wife Said in Court Papers

snippet: Rakeyia Scott sought a protective order last year against Mr. Scott, whose death at the hands of the Charlotte, N.C., police has set off protests....
abstract: North Carolina court records show that in 2015, Rakeyia Scott applied for protective order against her husband, Keith Lamont Scott, who was shot to death by police in Charlotte in October; filing claims Scott threatened to kill family members with gun; police say they recovered gun at scene of Scott's death, but family members counter that he did not have one with him at time of confrontation with police.
